unit_learning_outcomes.description: Show competency in  IoT Cloud implementation and IoT service.
Demonstrate knowledge of IoT mobile networks fundamentals and Standards
Showing competency in IoT Coverage , Channel Model, Link Budget
Able to describe IoT networks models and services
Working skills for IoT for smart infrastructure and IoT security

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Self-directed study and review of lecture resources

enrolment_rules.description: (Admission to MEngNetTeleEng or Admission to MEngElecEng) and 30CP at 3000-level or above

assessments.description: Groups will choose to build Hardware or software IoT Model

data.description: This unit explores the Internet of Things (IoT) including fundamentals, standards, non-cellular IoT, low-power wide-area networks,3GPP-cellular IoT, narrow-band IoT,  Machine type communications  LTE-M1, ultra-reliable communications, massive IoT, cellular-to-vehicle, vehicle-to-vehicle and vehicle-to-everything, coverage and capacity requirements, network architecture, cloud radio access technology, IoT security, IoT application for transport and automotive , smart cites, industry, agriculture etc, network management and operations, IoT big data analytics. Learning includes theory and practice using real-time live networks using a project based learning approach.
data.title: IoT Networks

description: This unit explores the Internet of Things (IoT) including fundamentals, standards, non-cellular IoT, low-power wide-area networks,3GPP-cellular IoT, narrow-band IoT,  Machine type communications  LTE-M1, ultra-reliable communications, massive IoT, cellular-to-vehicle, vehicle-to-vehicle and vehicle-to-everything, coverage and capacity requirements, network architecture, cloud radio access technology, IoT security, IoT application for transport and automotive , smart cites, industry, agriculture etc, network management and operations, IoT big data analytics. title: IoT Networks
